p: LA is the major fatty acid in seed oil – up to 42% –, being also present in the berry and pulp oil in lower concentration levels (6 to 33%). There are small variations of concentration in seed oil according to the subspecies, being higher in the subsp. rhamnoides than in subsp. sinensis. [ 1] In addition, sea buckthorn oil is the only oil that naturally presents a 1:1 ratio of omega-3: omega-6 [ 35].
